intro: Tephrosia rigida, commonly known as rigid tephrosia, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in dry to moist woodland habitats. Its seeds are encased in hard pods, and the plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Tephrosia rigida is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
